books.title: The Plastic Age
books.author: Percy Marks
books.summary: A student at an upscale liberal arts college navigates challenges, pitfalls, disillusionment, and the possibilities of his undergraduate experience in Jazz Age New England.

books.title: Tarzan of the Apes
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An orphan is raised by apes in Africa and goes on various adventures.

books.title: Wonderful Adventures of Mrs. Seacole in Many Lands
books.author: Mary Seacole
books.summary: A British Creole woman provides medical assistance during the Crimean War after her travels around Panama.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Understood Betsy
books.author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher
books.summary: A young girl discovers independence, responsibility, and newfound confidence after being sent to live in a farmhouse with her extended family.

books.title: Our American Cousin
books.author: Tom Taylor
books.summary: A rough American from a distant branch of the Trenchard family returns to England and quickly becomes embroiled in the family’s affairs.

books.title: Mrs. Warren’s Profession
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A young woman learns a secret about her mother’s past and must decide what it means for her future.

books.title: The House of Arden
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Two children, with the aid of a magical white mole, travel into the past in search of their family’s long-lost treasure.

books.title: When God Laughs
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: The eleventh collection of short stories by Jack London.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.

books.title: His Last Bow
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his faithful biographer tackle more mysterious cases.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A collection of Ambrose Bierce’s poetry.

books.title: Martin Eden
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A young working-class man sets out to become a bourgeois writer.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by H. Beam Piper ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Poul Anderson
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Poul Anderson ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
